York University's Boat Club divided to conquer last weekend, participating in Head of the River events both here in York, and on the Thames in London.

The Full Motty: musings from behind the MOTD microphone

It isn't everyday you have the opportunity to interview a national institution.

Hockey firsts consigned to relegation despite defiant stand in Varsity draw.

A valiant performance acquired a draw for York's hockey firsts against their cross-city rivals on Wednesday afternoon, but it wasn't enough to stave off relegation from BUCS Northern Conference 2B.

Hornets buzzing over first competition

Popularised by the film 'Bring it On', again by 'Bring it on Again' and then again by three further 'Bring it On' based sequels, cheerleading, once the sole preserve of Americans, has crossed the pond. Throughout the country, cheerleading squads have mobilised like secret militias.

Nick Waite: Roses 2009 Secretary

Considering Roses is the centrepiece of York's sporting calendar, it still baffles me to find people who are unaware of what it actually is! For the uninformed, I'll briefly explain: in 1964 a boat race between the universities of Lancaster and York began a contest that would evolve into the largest inter-university sports competition in Europe.

College Notebook: Swimming shenanigans

Sports Editor Adam Shergold discovered how the annual college swimming gala is an event which simply defies description...

The Mixer

So, with the Student Union elections fast approaching, and five potential York Sport presidents to keep us entertained, TM sent three politics-mad spies to the sports centre to find out who the students want to win. Now, it would be vaguely excusable if in Market Square a few biology students here and there didn't know the names of that famous five, but surely the sporties care how much they'll have to pay in York Sport membership next year? You'd be surprised...

Adam Shergold's Wednesday Round-up: March 4

He's back again, the renegade round-up master, with his weekly take on all Wednesday's BUCS action. In association, as always, with YSTV.

Double NUL disappointment for men's football

York's football firsts performed nowhere near their full potential in this rearranged and 'doubled up' Saturday fixture, their single goal loss counting for both NUL Cup elimination and the shipping of three very obtainable NUL points. (Thumbnail credit Photos: Arran Bowen-la Grange)

The art of the fight: discover your martial side

After Wedneday's exhibition in the Sports Centre, Nouse provides the low-down on the variety of martial arts clubs at York, with details of how you can get involved. (Thumbnail credit Photos: Justyn Hardcastle)

Basketballers finish with a deserved win over city rivals

Carrying on a recent tradition, York's men won a thrilling final match of the season today against city rivals York St. John. (Thumbnail credit Photos: Justyn Hardcastle)

Key Teesside victory has firsts back on track in BUCS league

Back-to-back BUCS wins have lifted the University of York football firsts off the bottom of Northern Conference 2B, giving renewed them hope of a mid-table finish.

Impressive Halifax take the spoils in tri-college rugby

By James Bithell

Halifax sent out an ominous warning ahead of the forthcoming college rugby ten's tournament by seeing off Vanbrugh and a Goodricke/Langwith team in Saturday's latest tri-college competition.

Rugby team step closer to title after overcoming Hull hurdle

The men's rugby firsts played nowhere near their brilliant best on Saturday afternoon, yet they still had too much for a Hull side that excelled in the plucky underdog role. (Thumbnail credit Photos: Irene Sieberger)

Men's tennis dumped out of BUCS Cup in semis

York men's tennis team saw their recent momentum fade away in a crushing 8-2 BUCS Cup semi-final defeat at the hands of Sheffield firsts on Wednesday. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Adam Shergold's Wednesday Round-up: 25 February

Sports Editor Adam Shergold has the last word on Wednesday's BUCS action in his must-read weekly round-up.

Cup disappointment for impressive squash team

A fantastic run to the semi-finals of the BUCS Cup ended yesterday for York's squash team with a tense, tight match against Manchester seconds that could have gone either way. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

York smash past Hallam to reach BUCS Cup final

York showed a steely determination in winning through to the BUCS Cup final with a tough victory against Sheffield Hallam on Wednesday. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Rain Astin-Chamberlain)

Equestrian team tops table going into final Regionals qualifier

York's Equestrian 'A' team are top of their table going into the final qualifying round for the northern Regionals after a superb home performance last week. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Gemma Johnson)

Polo club competes in its first ever national tournament

Club Secretary Jessica Grundy reports on an encouraging first nationals appearance for York Polo Club as it attempts to break away from the common perceptions of elitism surrounding the sport.

Netball women bite back at Huddersfield with superb win

A superb peformance saw York beat top-of-the-table Huddersfield last Wednesday, and narrow the gap at the top to three points. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Sam Newsome)

Adam Shergold's Wednesday Round-up: 18 February

Sports Editor Adam Shergold reviews all Wednesday's action in his regular round-up in association with YSTV.

Impressive men's tennis brush aside Durham

York men's tennis firsts offered a long-awaited glimpse of their class in winning 7-3 against Durham seconds, their first victory in the league this season, on Wednesday afternoon.

Insatiable rugby firsts step closer to championship glory

Recording their eighth successive league victory, York adapted best in horrendous conditions to comfortably overcome Sheffield University on Wednesday afternoon and, in the process, move closer to wrapping up the BUCS Northern Conference 2B title. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Fiery basketballers snuffed out in second overtime

York mounted three hefty comebacks in this game and, like any great team, didn't seem to know when they were beaten, except when the actually were, which was at the end of the second period of over time. (Thumbnail credit Photo: Alexandru Hristea)

Season's best earns first hockey point in Durham draw

Seventy minutes of gripping hockey delivered York's cherished first point of the campaign against Durham on Wednesday but their excellent performance deserved more. (Thumbnail credit Sam Newsome)

Disappointing cup exit for football firsts

It was a game there for the taking, with a place in the semi-finals of the BUCS Cup at stake, but York's football firsts slumped to a 2-0 loss against Leeds Met Carnegie thirds yesterday. (Thumbnail credit Justyn Hardcastle)

Stirring fightback earns point for Hockey women in derby

With another collective heave, York's hockey women continued their revival of late with a rousing fightback from two down against York St. John on Wednesday afternoon. (Thumbnail credit Arran Bowen-la Grange)

York basketballers narrow losers in thriller

For the neutral it was thrilling - but there were not many of those courtside to see York men's basketball team narrowly lose 48-49 to Sheffield Hallam yesterday. (Thumbnail credit Alexandru Hristea)

Marlies Neuner scooped the individual snowboarding gold to cap a successful YUsnow performance at the British University Indoor Snowsports Championships (BUISC) last Wednesday. (Thumbnail credit YUsnow team at the BUISC Championships)
